Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
Controller.ModifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller class provides control logic for the modify parts form of the application.
Author:
Alexandria Lim

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the controller.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location that is used to resolve relative paths for the root object.
      resourceBundle - The resources that are used to localize the root object.

    • cancel

      public void cancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method ignores the users inputted product data and returns back to main.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - click button to cancel and return back to main.
      Throws:
      IOException

      public void addPartToModifyProduct()
      This method allows a user to add a part to a product.

    • saveChangesToProduct

      public void saveChangesToProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method saves inputted product data and added or removed parts and associates it with the selected product and then returns the user to the main screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - click button to save product data and return back to main.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getPartResults

      public void getPartResults()
      This method searches a table for any items that have string of characters or a number that the user has inputted. It compares the user input to names of the parts or the ID number of a part. If the search box is empty, the table loads all values.
